Package sample.bibliothek

Class Zettelkasten

java.lang.Object
sample.bibliothek.Zettelkasten
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<Medium>
public class Zettelkasten
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Medium>, java.io.Serializable
Saves all mediums and includes functions to change, remove, or insert medium

      public boolean dropMedium​(java.lang.String _titel) throws Zettelkasten.DuplicateEntry
      Removes the Medium from the ArrayList myZettelKasten
      Parameters:
      _titel - helps to find the Medium, which must be removed
      Returns:
      true if the Medium is removed, else return false
      Throws:
      Zettelkasten.DuplicateEntry - if there are more than one element to delete with the given title

    • sort

      public boolean sort​(java.lang.String sortAlgorithm)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • findWikiBook

      public Medium findWikiBook​(java.lang.String title) throws org.xml.sax.SAXException, java.io.IOException, BookNotFoundException
      Is tested with the titles: 1.)Die_Kunst,_glücklich_zu_leben 2.)Die_Sprache_der_Mathematik 3.) Interessante_Messungen 4.) RFID_Technologie Argument: "String title" is given by configuration for "Application" filters out the Author, last edition, date, shelf and Table of content from the XML
      Parameters:
      title - finds wikiBook with the given title; title format: enter instead of spaces underscore
      Returns:
      Wikibook elBook if the Book with the given title is found, else null with errormessage
      Throws:
      org.xml.sax.SAXException - if exists error in XML parser
      java.io.IOException - if the XML file not found
      BookNotFoundException
